intro: Leucosyke rhodopleura, commonly known as the red-veined ivy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often used in ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and attractive addition to tropical and subtropical landscapes.
